Package tournamentmanager.core.api

Interface Tournament

All Known Implementing Classes:
TournamentImpl
public interface Tournament
Represents a single-elimination tournament, and can be used to manage both participants and games.

A Tournament is a sequence of Rounds, each round containing a set of Games, each Game eliminating one participant.

Single-elimination means that a Participant is eliminated from the Tournament as soon as he or she lose one game.

A Tournament is managed in three phases (based on the values defined in the Status enumeration): - First, participants must be added to the Tournament. - Second, the Tournament can be started, which creates the game tree, and make it possible to register results. When a game is over, the participant is automatically sent to the next game. - Third, the Tournament can be ended, and the final ranking can be computed.

  • Method Details

    • addParticipant

      void addParticipant​(Participant participant) throws TournamentException
      Add a new participant to the Tournament. Can only be called before the Tournament has started.
      Parameters:
      participant - The Participant to add.
      Throws:
      TournamentException - If the Tournament has already started.

    • start

      void start() throws TournamentException
      Start the tournament. This will shuffle the list of participantts, create the complete tournament tree, and assign participants to their first games in the first round.

      Can only be called if the Tournament has not started, and if the number of participants is more than 1, and if the number of participants is a power of two. Cannot be undone.

      Throws:
      TournamentException - If the tournament has already started, or if there are strictly less than 2 participants, or if the number of participants is not a power of two.

    • end

      void end() throws TournamentException
      End the tournament. Once a tournament has ended, no new results can be registered.

      Can only be called if the Tournament has already started, and if all games have ended.

      Throws:
      TournamentException - If the tournament has not started, or if some games have not ended yet.

    • getAllGames

      List<Game> getAllGames()
      Retrieve all the games of the Tournament tree.
      Returns:
      All the games of the Tournament tree.

    • getRounds

      List<List<Game>> getRounds()
      Retrieve all rounds of the Tournament. A round is simply a list of Games that take place in parallel.
      Returns:
      The list of rounds.

    • getGamesReadyToStart

      List<Game> getGamesReadyToStart()
      Retrieve all Games of the tournament tree that are ready to start. A Game is ready to start if it has two participants and if it has neither started or ended.
      Returns:
      All Games of the tournament tree that are ready to start.

    • getFinishedGames

      List<Game> getFinishedGames()
      Retrieve all Games of the tournament tree that are finished.
      Returns:
      All Games of the tournament tree that are finished.

    • getGamesInProgress

      List<Game> getGamesInProgress()
      Retrieve all games of the tournament tree that are in progress.
      Returns:
      All games of the tournament tree that are in progress.

    • getFutureGames

      List<Game> getFutureGames()
      Retrieve all games of the tournament tree that are not ready to start and that will be played in the future.
      Returns:
      All future games of the tournament tree.

    • computeFinalRanking

      List<Set<Participant>> computeFinalRanking() throws TournamentException
      Compute the final ranking based on the Tournament results, and return it.

      The computed ranking is provided as an *ordered partition*, which is essentially a list of sets. Each set contains one of several Participants that are ex-æquo. The list of set gives the ranking among sets of Participants.

      Two participants are ex-æquo if they were eliminated in the same round.

      Can only be called after the Tournament has ended.

      Returns:
      The final ranking.
      Throws:
      TournamentException

    • getStatus

      Status getStatus()
      Retrieve the Status of the Tournament. It can either be: - NOTSTARTED when adding players and setting seeds, - INPROGRESS when playing games and registering results, - FINISHED when no more games can be played and the final ranking can be computed.
      Returns:
      The current Status of the Tournament.
